Deal_Acceleration_Summary__c:
Date: 04-09-2025

Opportunity Diagnosis & Executive Summary for Perth Airport (Australia)

1. Opportunity History Summary (120 words)

  • August 22, 2025: First executive-level engagement with Perth Airport’s CPO in Sydney—early-stage relationship building.
  • No compelling event or urgency identified; project is planned for 2025, suggesting a long-term initiative.
  • Engagement confidence is low (25%) due to lack of follow-up and unclear next steps.
  • No confirmed date for the next meeting in Perth; this poses a risk of losing momentum.
  • No documented objections or competitive threats, but inertia and lack of urgency could open the door for competitors.
  • Recommendations include: confirming Perth meeting by September 18, defining the business problem, identifying a compelling event, and assigning a Zycus executive sponsor.

2. Market Research Summary (120 words)

  • Perth Airport is focused on cost efficiency and capital discipline due to inflationary pressures and rising operational costs.
  • Major infrastructure projects (e.g., terminal upgrades) are underway—require robust procurement and supplier management.
  • Procurement transformation aligns with Zycus’ Spend Analysis, Sourcing, CLM, and Supplier Management modules.
  • Supply chain resilience and stakeholder relationship management are strategic priorities.
  • Compliance and governance are critical due to the regulated nature of the aviation industry—Zycus CLM can support this.
  • No explicit procurement software initiative mentioned, but cost optimization and project delivery goals suggest a strong fit.
  • No compelling event identified, but infrastructure timelines and cost pressures can be shaped into urgency drivers.

3. Digital Engagement Summary

  • Top visited pages: None (Web Traffic = 0)
  • Buyer intent keywords: None detected
  • Visit patterns: No recent digital engagement from Perth Airport on Zycus platforms

4. Playbook Alignment Analysis

Completed Requirements:

  • Initial executive engagement with CPO (Authority touchpoint)
  • Opportunity is in Qualified stage with a defined long-term project (Timeline partially inferred)
  • Early relationship-building initiated (Lead nurturing started)

Pending Steps:

  • No documented discovery call or pain point articulation (Need not clearly defined)
  • No multi-threaded relationships or organizational mapping
  • No confirmed follow-up meeting or bi-weekly check-ins scheduled
  • No documented RFI/RFP influence or pre-sales engagement
  • No executive sponsor from Zycus assigned
  • No tailored thought leadership or content shared
  • No CRM documentation of detailed interactions or nurturing plan

5. BANT Qualifying Identifiers

  • B (Budget) – Not Qualified
    No indication of budget allocation or business case development for procurement transformation.
  • A (Authority) – Qualified
    Engagement with the CPO (Chief Procurement Officer) confirms access to a key decision-maker.
  • N (Need) – Not Qualified
    Business problem is implied (procurement transformation), but not explicitly defined or validated with the customer.
  • T (Timeline) – Qualified
    Project is planned for 2025, with a close date of January 30, 2026, indicating a 12–15 month window.

6. Final Recommendations for Deal Acceleration

Critical Next Steps + Risk Mitigation Plan

  • Confirm and schedule the Perth meeting with the CPO by September 18, 2025, to maintain momentum and deepen executive alignment.
  • Conduct a structured discovery session during the Perth meeting to define the business problem and validate pain points. Due: September 25, 2025
  • Assign a Zycus executive sponsor to support CK and LD in relationship building. Due: September 10, 2025
  • Develop a multi-threaded engagement plan to identify and connect with other key stakeholders (e.g., CFO, Head of Infrastructure). Due: October 2, 2025
  • Share tailored thought leadership content (e.g., airport procurement best practices, cost optimization case studies). Due: October 9, 2025
  • Identify or co-create a compelling event (e.g., upcoming contract renewal, compliance deadline, or cost-saving initiative). Due: October 16, 2025
  • Begin pre-sales alignment to prepare for potential RFI/RFP influence. Due: October 23, 2025

Best Talking Points for Zycus' Leadership

Key Conversation Focus Areas:

  • How Zycus can support Perth Airport’s cost optimization and capital project delivery goals
  • Enhancing supplier performance and risk management for infrastructure projects
  • Ensuring compliance and governance through automated contract lifecycle management

Confidence-Building Factors:

  • Zycus’ proven success in regulated industries and infrastructure-heavy organizations
  • Modular solutions that align with Perth Airport’s strategic procurement goals
  • Ability to deliver quick wins through spend analysis and sourcing optimization

Uncertainties:

  • No clarity on budget availability or procurement software evaluation process
  • No visibility into internal champions beyond the CPO
  • Lack of digital engagement suggests low awareness or interest—requires proactive outreach

Due Date Summary (based on today’s date: 2025-09-04 and close date: 2026-01-30)

  • Assign Zycus Executive Sponsor: September 10, 2025
  • Confirm Perth Meeting: September 18, 2025
  • Conduct Discovery Session: September 25, 2025
  • Map Stakeholders & Build Multi-threaded Plan: October 2, 2025
  • Share Tailored Content: October 9, 2025
  • Identify/Shape Compelling Event: October 16, 2025
  • Begin Pre-Sales Alignment: October 23, 2025

End of Report.
